pattern.name: Accented
pattern.description:
Does the string contain a common accented character?
Note: In MySQL we would have to use nested replace().
pattern.example: In some countries, Latin alphabet is enriched by accents. But it takes time to write these accents. Consequently, informal text is written without accents. While formal text is still written with accents. Thus, this feature can asses the formality of the entered text.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT @base , case when translate(@characterColumn, 'áàâãäåāăąèééêëēĕėęěìíîïìĩīĭḩóôõöōŏőùúûüũūŭůäàáâãåæçćĉčöòóôõøüùúûßéèêëýñîìíïşěščřžýáíéůúťňďÁČĎÉĚÍŇÓŘŠŤÚŮŽÝŽ', 'aaaaaaaaaeeeeeeeeeeiiiiiiiihooooooouuuuuuuuaaaaaaeccccoooooouuuuseeeeyniiiisescrzyaieuutndACDEEINORSTUUZYZ' )=@characterColumn then 0 else 1 end AS @columnName FROM @propagatedTable WHERE @characterColumn is not null
